    • visit

      public void visit(CreateNewGameMessage message)
      This method is used to visit CreateNewGameMessage received from client. It searches for ClientHandlerSocket associated to . If exists, it calls MainController to effectively build a new game.
      Specified by:
      visit in interface GameHandlingMessageVisitor
      Parameters:
      message - MessageToServer to handle

    • visit

      public void visit(NewUserMessage message)
      This method is used to visit NewUserMessage received from client. It checks that client is new to server (e.g. it is in connectedClients hashmap, and it has a not null token). If yes, it calls MainController to build the player, compute its private token and send to client a new CreatedPlayerMessage. If no, it closes player's socket
      Specified by:
      visit in interface GameHandlingMessageVisitor
      Parameters:
      message - NewUserMessage to handle

    • visit

      public void visit(ReconnectToServerMessage message)
      This method is used to reconnect a client to the server. First, it checks if client is already active (e.g. it's constantly sending heartbeats). If ye, it sends to it a NetworkHandlingErrorMessage. If no, it checks if in connectedClients there is a Socket with the same token. If exists, it closes the previous socket, interrupts previous ClientHandlerSocket and MessageToServerDispatcher, builds new ClientHandlerSocket and notifies MainController that a player has to be reconnected.
      Specified by:
      visit in interface GameHandlingMessageVisitor
      Parameters:
      message - ReconnectToServerMessage to handle

    • visit

      public void visit(DisconnectMessage message)
      This method is used to handle DisconnectMessage received from player. It calls MainServerTCP.disconnectSocket(Socket). It also sends to the player a DisconnectFromServerMessage.
      Specified by:
      visit in interface GameHandlingMessageVisitor
      Parameters:
      message - DisconnectMessage to handle

    • visit

      public void visit(JoinGameMessage message)
      This method is used to handle JoinGameMessage received from client. First, it checks if client is registered to server using MainServerTCP.getClientHandlerFromSocket(Socket). If yes, it notifies MainController to register ClientHandlerSocket to the specified game if possible.
      Specified by:
      visit in interface GameHandlingMessageVisitor
      Parameters:
      message - JoinGameMessage to handle.

    • visit

      public void visit(JoinFirstAvailableGameMessage message)
      This method is used to handle JoinFirstAvailableGameMessage. First, it checks if client is registered to server using MainServerTCP.getClientHandlerFromSocket(Socket). If yes, it notifies MainController that a player would like to join first available game.
      Specified by:
      visit in interface GameHandlingMessageVisitor
      Parameters:
      message - JoinFirstAvailableGameMessage to handle.

    • visit

      public void visit(RequestAvailableGamesMessage message)
      This method is used to handle RequestAvailableGamesMessage message. First, it checks if requesting client is already registered to server using MainServerTCP.getClientHandlerFromSocket(Socket). If yes, it sends to a AvailableGamesMessage with all available games.
      Specified by:
      visit in interface GameHandlingMessageVisitor
      Parameters:
      message - RequestAvailableGamesMessage to handle.

    • visit

      public void visit(RequestGameExitMessage message)
      This method is used to handle RequestGameExitMessage message. First, it checks if requesting client is already registered to server using MainServerTCP.getClientHandlerFromSocket(Socket). If yes, it calls MainController.disconnectPlayerFromGame(ClientHandler) to disconnect the player from the game.
      Specified by:
      visit in interface GameHandlingMessageVisitor
      Parameters:
      message - RequestGameExitMessage to handle.
